dlgPart.npc_text:
[perception success]Trying to spot anything out of the ordinary in the crumbling brickwork is difficult; after all, what is one loose brick amongst many? But in the end you find it, a brick that shifts under pressure, but in a way that suggests that the movement was by design, not accident or decay. A switch.
You hesitate before pressing it, but fortunately nothing untoward occurs. Unfortunately, nothing happens at all.

There is no way to figure out the switch's function with this wall in the way. So, unlimbering your tools, you set to work. Soon, a pile of rubble is at your feet and sweat runs down your face. But there, exposed to the open for probably the first time in centuries, is a large, rusted cylindrical device. The design is strange, but it looks like some type of pump.
You glance back at the drain. If the pump was to keep the cellar from being flooded, why was it hidden?
